The Philippines became free of Spain in 1898 by the combined efforts of the USA and the Filipinos themselves. (The idea that the Philippines was “part of Spain” already is ludicrous, except in a purely legalistic sense. Filipinos were NOT Spaniards, and were not treated as such, and they knew it, which is why they rebelled against Spain.) The Philippine Revolution against Spain began in 1896 but foundered after a year or so, with its leaders withdrawing overseas after a “pact” with the Spanish authorities that supposedly brought peace, but in actuality was just a pause in the ongoing hostilities. In the interim the USA went to war with Spain over events in Cuba, primarily. As a side-effect of this the US Pacific Fleet (under Commodore Dewey) seized Manila harbor and destroyed the Spanish fleet there, thus giving them control of Philippine waters; they also brought Emilio Aguinaldo back from exile, at which time he proclaimed the Philippines an independent Republic, though both Americans (by sea) and Spaniards (by land) were still very much around. The USA, meanwhile, sent ground forces to the Philippines, and shortly after their arrival, arranged to defeat the Spanish garrison in Manila and accept their surrender. In the ensuing peace negotiations, Spain surrendered all its claims in the Philippines to the USA (more or less in return for $20 million, though it was not technically a sale), and both colonial powers simply ignored the claims of the infant Republic. Thus by late 1898 the Philippines was freed from Spain, but had to combat the claims of the new imperialists, the USA. The Philippine-American War broke out in early 1899 and lasted three years (or more, depending on how you count the end of it), with the Republic defeated and the fleeting independence of the country gone until 1946, when the USA finally recognized it. So the answer to your question could be: (1) Filipinos and the USA; or (2) the USA, with armed assistance from the Philippine Republic; or (3) the Philippine Republic, with armed assistance from the USA. YMMV.
